article_title: A ‘Two-by-Four Between the Eyes’: Judge Sentences Anti-Chevron Crusader to Jail Time — Just Days After U.N. Group Called for His Release
meta_description: An environmental advocate who helped obtain a $9.5 billion judgment against Chevron for oil drilling in Ecuador was sentenced to spend six months in jail after a federal judge found him guilty of contempt of court, following an unusual court-ordered prosecution denounced by Nobel Prize winners, multiple bar associations, U.S. lawmakers and a United Nations working group on arbitrary detention.
authors: ["Law Crime'S Managing Editor Adam Klasfeld Has Spent More Than A Decade On The Legal Beat. Previously A Reporter For Courthouse News", 'He Has Appeared As A Guest On Msnbc', 'Bbc', 'Npr', 'Pbs', 'Sky News', 'Other Networks.']

article_title: DOJ and Texas face off in court over restrictive abortion law
meta_description: Lawyers from the Justice Department and the state of Texas faced off in court Friday over a lawsuit challenging the state's restrictive abortion law.

article_title: All Democrats must compromise to pass economic plans, just like 1993
meta_description: Of course, this time around the House must also pass a major infrastructure package linked to budget reconciliation passage.

article_title: 'The Addams Family 2' hits the road to scare up more laughs
meta_description: After its live-action movies in the 1990s, the Addams Family has found a logical foothold in animation, with "The Addams Family 2" scaring up enough laughs to merit the return, with a mix of low-brow humor for kids and old-time callbacks certain to sail over their heads. Only mildly creepy, it's just kooky enough to merit an encore, this time via a hybrid theatrical-digital release.

meta_description: Unvaccinated pregnant women are more than twice as likely than non-pregnant women to need the ICU or a ventilator when they contract Covid, Walensky said.

article_title: Biden team’s booster divide deepens as risk of winter virus surge looms
Alabama lawmakers OK plan to build prisons with virus cash
meta_description: MONTGOMERY, Ala. (AP) — Amid a national debate over the use of pandemic relief funds, Alabama lawmakers swiftly approved a plan Friday to tap $400 million from the American Rescue Plan to help build two super-size prisons, brushing off criticism from congressional Democrats that the money was not intended for such projects.

article_title: US surpasses 700,000 Covid-19 deaths
meta_description: The US surpassed 700,000 deaths from Covid-19 on Friday, 108 days after the country reached 600,000 deaths from the virus, according to data from Johns Hopkins University.

article_title: Georgia’s ex-president arrested after returning home
meta_description: TBILISI, Georgia (AP) — Former President Mikheil Saakashvili was arrested after returning to Georgia, the government said Friday, a move that came as the ex-leader sought to mobilize supporters ahead of national municipal elections seen as critical to the country's political makeup.

article_title: Turkish Red Crescent sending aid to feed displaced Afghans

article_title: Maryland Fugitive Captured After Killing His Brother, Sister-in-Law, and an 83-Year-Old Woman: Cops
meta_description: The search is over for a man who allegedly killed three people across two Maryland counties. Jeffrey Allen Burnham, 46, was arrested over in Davis, West Virginia, according to cops. He was wanted for killing his brother Brian Robinette, 58, sister-in-law Kelly Sue Robinette, 57, and also Rebecca Reynolds, 83.

article_title: 17-Year-Old Boy Allegedly Stabbed His Twin Sister to Death, Claimed He Did It in His Sleep
meta_description: A 17-year-old boy allegedly stabbed his twin sister to death, but he insisted he did it in his sleep. Harris County Sheriff Ed Gonzalez identified the defendant as Benjamin Elliott, and the victim as Meghan Elliott, 17.

article_title: California Gunman Sentenced to Life in Prison Without Parole for Deadly Synagogue Shooting
meta_description: John Earnest, who shot and killed one woman and injured three others when he attacked a Southern California synagogue in April 2019, was sentenced to life in prison without parole

article_title: Manchin Might Not Be Biden’s Biggest Problem
meta_description: Joe Manchin might not be the biggest obstacle to passing Joe Biden’s Build Back Better agenda. On Thursday, Manchin’s private demands for the bill, outlined in an agreement with Chuck Schumer, became public. They’re easier to satisfy than Sinema’s.

meta_description: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott (R) is calling on state lawmakers to stiffen the penalties for illegal voting.
